content.description: Short and easy Arete problem that ends at the top of Grassy Knoll.
content.location: Immediately right of Grassy Knoll, on the front/right face.

content.description: Baked's wonky cousin. Can get pumpy, depending on your skill level, BE VERY CAREFUL, this climb is dangerous just like Baked. Make your way up the left side of the chimney thing, holds are pretty solid, top-out is decent but not perfect. DO NOT CLIMB ALONE.
content.location: The front of the boulder, make your way up the left side of the chimney thing.

content.description: Slabby and chossy, but the choss isn't a big deal. A nice quick slab climb.
content.location: Start at the Right side of the right/front of the boulder, to the left of Playground

content.description: The feature climb of the boulder. BE CAREFUL as there is no good way to provide protection. A very fun Chimney climb with many options for holds. DO NOT GO ALONE.
content.location: Left side of the Boulder. Stay close to the outside of the chimney for some layback potential, or move further inside for a tighter and more enclosed experience. Both options are V1 in my opinion, if you move further in to the Chimney, it could be considered a V1+.

content.description: A hidden gem with a lot of potential, 12-15ft easy boulder problems. Features a few slab sections, as well as Aretes and the main feature, a really fun 15-foot CHIMNEY. Chossy, but I live in the area and hope to improve the rock and find more routes.
